channel.title: Working ::pickup command
channel.description:
Well, I want to see if my new items "work" , But i have 6 sources, And none have a working ::pickup command.
Help please?

item.title: Working ::pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“blitz_9100, post:2, topic:160496”]do you mean a working pickup command for silabsoft’s client?

if so then use this one

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("usage Use as ::pickup 800 100"); } } ’

sorry its compressed to reduce command lag[/quote]
LOL.
What on earth are you talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: Working ::pickup command
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

o ok then heres mine thats non silab

if (command.startsWith("pickup")) {
				try {
					int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11));
					int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12));
					if (/*newItemID <= 10000 && */newItemID >= 0) {
						addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
					} else {
						sendMessage("No such item.");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10");
				}
			}

hope this helps

Read full topic
